intro: Gymnostephium angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gymnostephium, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas. Gymnostephium angustifolium is often found in wetlands and is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
